uws.job.serializer

Class XMLSerializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • uws.job.serializer.UWSSerializer
      • uws.job.serializer.XMLSerializer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class XMLSerializer
extends UWSSerializer
    Lets serializing any UWS resource in XML.
    Version:
    4.2 (10/2015)
    Author:
    Grégory Mantelet (CDS;ARI)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getHeader

        public java.lang.String getHeader()

        Gets the XML file header (xml version, encoding and the xslt style-sheet link if any).

        It is always called by the implementation of the UWSSerializer functions if their boolean parameter (root) is true.

        Returns:
        The XML file header.

      • getUWSNamespace

        public java.lang.String getUWSNamespace()
        Gets all UWS namespaces declarations needed for an XML representation of a UWS object.
        Returns:
        The UWS namespaces:
        (i.e. = "xmlns:uws=[...] xmlns:xlink=[...] xmlns:xs=[...] xmlns:xsi=[...] xsi:schemaLocation=[...]").

      • getUWSNamespace

        protected final java.lang.String getUWSNamespace(boolean root)
        Gets the node attributes which declare the UWS namespace.
        Parameters:
        root - false if the attribute to serialize will be included in a top level serialization (for a job attribute: job), true otherwise.
        Returns:
        "" if root is false, " "+UWSNamespace otherwise.
        See Also:
        getUWSNamespace()

      • getJobList

        public java.lang.String getJobList(JobList jobsList,
                          JobOwner owner,
                          JobListFilter filter,
                          boolean root)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: UWSSerializer
        Serializes the given jobs list, by filtering using user-specified filters.
        Specified by:
        getJobList in class UWSSerializer
        Parameters:
        jobsList - The jobs list to serialize.
        owner - The user which has asked the serialization of the given jobs list. If null, all anonymous jobs are displayed.
        filter - Represent all the specified job filters to apply ; only the job that pass through this filter should be displayed. If null, all jobs are displayed.
        root - false if the jobs list to serialize will be included in a top level serialization (for a jobs list: uws), true otherwise.
        Returns:
        The serialization of the given jobs list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If there is an error during the serialization.

      • formatPieceOfJobInfo

        protected java.lang.String formatPieceOfJobInfo(java.lang.Object value,
                                    java.lang.String newLine)

        Format the given value of piece of job information.

        By default, this function is able to format the given types of object:

        • Date: formatted using the ISO-8601 format.
        • Map.Entry<?,?>: formated as a new XML child where the node name will be the key and the node content will be the value.
        • Array or Collection<?>: each item is formatted using this function and they are separated by a new line if they are Map.Entry<?,?> or a ';' otherwise.
        • Other: the function toString() is merely called.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to format.
        newLine - The string creating a new line.
        Returns:
        The formated value.
        Since:
        4.2

      • escapeXMLData

        public static java.lang.String escapeXMLData(java.lang.String data)
        Escapes the content of a node (data between the open and the close tags).
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The escaped URL.
        See Also:

      • ensureLegalXml

        public static char ensureLegalXml(char c)

        Returns a legal XML character corresponding to an input character. Certain characters are simply illegal in XML (regardless of encoding). If the input character is legal in XML, it is returned; otherwise some other weird but legal character (currently the inverted question mark, "") is returned instead.

        Note: copy of the STILTS VOSerializer.ensureLegalXml(char) function.

        Parameters:
        c - input character
        Returns:
        legal XML character, c if possible
        Since:
        4.1
